Description: Limestone ostracon: on one side only, a drawing in black ink of a standing figure of the god Ptah, almost complete. The uraeus at the forehead is remarkable.
Curator's comments: For a similar figure of Ptah (also with a uraeus at the forehead) see O. Berlin P. 15345V. in E. Brunner-Traut 'Die altägyptischen Scherbenbilder’. Bibliography: E. Brunner-Traut, 'Die altägyptischen Scherbenbilder’ (Wiesbaden, 1956), p.25, no.10.
